Programming in Haskell

# 

<span key="d5c78d197a0048f8bfcdddf9d841dd4e"><span offset-key="d5c78d197a0048f8bfcdddf9d841dd4e:0">Foreword</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="047cc6a115ab4730baf6fae8d9222d99"><span offset-key="047cc6a115ab4730baf6fae8d9222d99:0">Adding recursion in the form of feedback-loops to pure combinational circuits lets us implement mutable state via flip-flops.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="4269e1e91b964de8b6fc449795b6ddf4"><span offset-key="4269e1e91b964de8b6fc449795b6ddf4:0">True value of functional programming lies in leveraging first-class functions to achieve compositionality and equational reasoning.</span></span>

# 

<span key="985592cccf154832a671199b7c573062"><span offset-key="985592cccf154832a671199b7c573062:0">Part 1 - basic concepts</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="c8d0293a5764408aaabf51336857706b"><span offset-key="c8d0293a5764408aaabf51336857706b:0">Functional programming can be viewed as a style of programming in which the basic method of computation is the application of functions to arguments.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="f83ef61084e84257bb37e319300ae9d9"><span offset-key="f83ef61084e84257bb37e319300ae9d9:0">Functional programming language is one that supports and encourages the functional style.</span></span>

<a href="programming-in-haskell.html#part-1-basic-concepts" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-855088 r-dwliz8 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-lqms97 r-dnmrzs r-iphfwy r-1guathk r-1h8ys4a r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr r-7xmw5f"></a>

Part 1 - basic concepts
